noImplicitAnyLet.description:
Description

Disallow use of implicitanytype on variable declarations.
TypeScript variable declaration without any type annotation and initialization have theanytype.
The any type in TypeScript is a dangerous “escape hatch” from the type system.
Using any disables many type checking rules and is generally best used only as a last resort or when prototyping code.
TypeScript’s--noImplicitAnycompiler optiondoesn’t report this case.
noImplicitAnyLet.option: This rule has no specific options.
